newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Botswana pres says committed to economic reform.
newsitem.headline: Botswana pres says committed to economic reform.

text.p: Botswana's President Ketumile Masire said on Wednesday the huge and arid southern African country would remain committed to its programme of economic reforms in order to woo foreign investors.

Masire's government has embarked on a programme of economic liberalisation aimed at privatising state assets and diversifying the country's economy away from its traditional reliance on diamond mining.

Masire told the Southern African Trade and Investment Summit in Harare that his government would seek to maintain its current policies on wage rates, tax rates, interest rates and deregulation of public services.
"We aim to build a solid foundation for sustainable economic diversification," Masire said.
Business leaders and politicians are gathered at the summit hoping to promote regional trade and lure foreign trade into the area.
"We will promote domestic and foreign investment and have created (in Botswana) an economy which is conducive to the idea of the private sector," Masire said.
